description: Literature talk involves storytelling, narrative language, imaginative play, and references to books, stories, characters, and fictional elements. It includes creative expression, narrative structure, and literary concepts.
characteristics: Uses narrative language and story structure
Discusses story elements (beginning, middle, end, characters)

examples.text: Once upon a time, there was a princess in a castle. She was kind and brave. One day, a dragon came. The princess saved the day.
Let's read this book. It has pictures. The story is about a bear who goes on an adventure. I love this part!
I'm pretending to be a superhero. I can fly! I'm saving the city from monsters. This is my superpower.
The story starts with a little girl. Then she finds a magic door. At the end, she learns an important lesson.
Once upon a time, there was a magic forest. The trees could talk. The animals were friends. They lived happily ever after.
I'm drawing a picture of the story. This is the character. Here's the setting. The story happens here.
Let me tell you a story. It begins with a cat. The cat goes on a journey. She meets friends. They have adventures together.
The book has chapters. We're on chapter three. The character is in trouble now. I wonder what happens next.
I'm making up a story about a robot. The robot wants to be a friend. It learns about feelings. The end is happy.
The author wrote this book. The illustrator drew the pictures. Together they made a beautiful story for us to read.
